text: SummerSlam (2000) was a professional wrestling pay-per-view show made by World Wrestling Federation (WWF). It was held on August 27, 2000 at Raleigh Entertainment and Sports Arena in Raleigh, North Carolina. It was the thirteenth SummerSlam event held by the WWF. The main event saw The Rock defeat Triple H and Kurt Angle in a Triple threat match to retain his WWF Championship. The Rock won the match by pinfall after he hit Triple H with the People's Elbow. A featured match on the undercard saw Kane and The Undertaker fight to a no contest. the match ended in a no contest after Undertaker unmasked Kane. Another main match on the undercard was Edge and Christian (c), The Hardy Boyz (Matt Hardy and Jeff Hardy) and The Dudley Boyz (Bubba Ray Dudley and D-Von Dudley) in the first Tables, Ladders, and Chairs match for the WWF Tag Team Championship. Edge and Christian won the match after they climbed the ladder and grabbed the belts that were hanging above the ring. ==Matches== # Matches Stipulations Times 1 Right to Censor (Steven Richards, Bull Buchanan, and The Goodfather) defeated Too Cool (Scotty 2 Hotty, Grand Master Sexay, and Rikishi) (with Victoria and Mandy) Six-man tag team match 5:12 2 X-Pac defeated Road Dogg Singles match 4:42 3 Chyna and Eddie Guerrero defeated Val Venis (c) and Trish Stratus Mixed tag team match for the WWF Intercontinental Championship 7:13 4 Jerry Lawler defeated Tazz Singles match 4:24 5 Steve Blackman defeated Shane McMahon (c) Hardcore match for the WWF Hardcore Championship 10:08 6 Chris Benoit defeated Chris Jericho Two out of three falls match 25:11 7 Edge and Christian (c) defeated The Hardy Boyz (Matt Hardy and Jeff Hardy) and The Dudley Boyz (Bubba Ray Dudley and D-Von Dudley) Tables, Ladders, and Chairs match for the WWF Tag Team Championship 14:51 8 The Kat (with Al Snow) defeated Terri (with Perry Saturn) Stinkface match 3:06 9 The Undertaker vs. Kane ended in a no contest Singles match 15:33 10 The Rock (c) defeated Kurt Angle and Triple H (with Stephanie McMahon-Helmsley) Triple threat match for the WWF Championship 16:01 (c) â€“ refers to the champion(s) heading into the match ==References== ==Other websites== *Official SummerSlam 2000 website Category:2000 in American television Category:2000 in professional wrestling Category:2000s in sports in North Carolina Category:SummerSlam
title: SummerSlam (2000)
